meanings.definition: To surpass in learning or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outlearn her classmates in math.
meanings.sent2: I always try to outlearn myself and improve every day.
meanings.sent3: The young student outlearned the old professor in computer skills.
meanings.sent4: Her thirst for knowledge allowed her to outlearn any obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent5: He was determined to outlearn all his competitors and become the best in his field.

meanings.definition: To learn more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: I will outlearn my siblings and be the first to finish the puzzle.
meanings.sent2: She had a natural ability to outlearn anyone in her class.
meanings.sent3: The race was on to see who could outlearn the other in the new language.
meanings.sent4: His curiosity drove him to outlearn his peers and become the top student.
meanings.sent5: The young scientist was determined to outlearn her mentor and make groundbreaking discoveries.
